Hi Kylee,

This is from the diffusion flame example in matlab (diffflame.m)=
.  I  
haven't myself tried it:

Previous solution is saved with the follow=
ing command:

saveSoln(fl,'c2h6.xml','energy',['solution with energy equati=
on']);

And is reloaded like so:

% if the starting solution is to be read =
from a previously-saved
% solution, uncomment this line and edit the file n=
ame and solution id.
restore(fl,'c2h6.xml', 'energy')



On May 7, 2010, at=
 4:23 AM, kylee815 wrote:

> Hi,
>
> A solution is obtained from 1st runnin=
g with high CURVE value in  
> the primixed flame code in Python or Matlab.=
 I want to use the  
> solution as the starting estimate with low CURVE val=
ue. In Chemkin,  
> the keyword "RSTR" is used the same function..
>
> Do y=
ou know how to use a previouly comuted solution in Cantera?
>
> 


--Apple-Mail-1-727868854
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Type: text/html;
	charset=WINDOWS-1252
